summary: "The Nutcracker" is a famous ballet composed by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in 1892. It's based on a story by E.T.A. Hoffmann and takes place on Christmas Eve, imagined by a child. The ballet has two acts and was first choreographed by Marius Petipa. Although it didn't initially gain as much popularity as a shorter version called the "Nutcracker Suite," it eventually became very well-liked, especially in North America. Today, many ballet companies perform it, and it's known for its beautiful music, including the use of an instrument called the celesta.
title: The Nutcracker
